Trial_Design.evidence: Patients were randomized into 1 of 5 groups

Intervention.evidence: Labor analgesia was initiated on request with a DPE technique by epidural injection over 2 minutes of 15 mL of ropivacaine 0.1% with sufentanil 0.5 μg/mL after a dural puncture with a 25-gauge Whitacre needle.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Effective analgesia was defined as no additional requirement for a patient-controlled bolus during the first stage of labor.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Patients were randomized into 1 of 5 groups

Number_Randomised.evidence: One hundred laboring parturients received the DPE technique

Number_Analysed.evidence: 93 proceeded to have analgesia maintained with PIEB

Result_Outcome.evidence: The estimated values for EI50 and EI90 were 52.5 (95% CI, 48.4–62.6) minutes and 37.0 (95% CI, 28.4–40.9) minutes, respectively.
